free.jin
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  free.util.Struct
      free.jin.Game

public class Game
extends Struct

Represents a game of chess (or any other variant) on a chess server. This class includes many features that are not supported by some servers - it's up to the JinConnection implementation to emulate them as closely as possible. If it's genuinely impossibly to implement the feature, the implementation should provide a reasonable blank value. Server specific subclasses should add methods for retrieving all the information provided by the server.

Constructor Detail

Game

public Game(int gameType,
            Position initialPosition,
            int pliesSinceStart,
            java.lang.String whiteName,
            java.lang.String blackName,
            int whiteTime,
            int whiteInc,
            int blackTime,
            int blackInc,
            int whiteRating,
            int blackRating,
            java.lang.Object gameID,
            java.lang.String ratingCategoryString,
            boolean isRated,
            boolean isPlayed,
            java.lang.String whiteTitles,
            java.lang.String blackTitles,
            boolean initiallyFlipped,
            Player userPlayer)
Creates a new Game with the given game properties.

Parameters:
gameType - The type of the game - possible values are MY_GAME, OBSERVED_GAME and ISOLATED_BOARD.
initialPosition - The initial position in the game.
pliesSinceStart - The amount of from the actual beginning of the game to the inital position.
whiteName - The name of the player with the white pieces.
blackName - The name of the player with the black pieces.
whiteTime - The initial amount of time on the white player's clock, in milliseconds.
whiteInc - The amount of time the white player's clock is incremented by after each move he makes, in milliseconds.
blackTime - The initial amount of time on the black player's clock, in milliseconds.
blackInc - The amount of time the black player's clocks is incremented by after each move he makes, in milliseconds.
whiteRating - The rating of the player with the white pieces, or -1 if no rating (guest for example).
blackRating - The rating of the player with the black pieces, or -1 if no rating (guest for example).
isRated - Is the game rated?
gameID - A string identifying the game.
ratingCategoryString - A string identifying the rating category of the game ("Blitz" for example)
isPlayed - Is this a real game? false if an examined game.
whiteTitles - The titles of the player with the white pieces.
blackTitles - the titles of the player with the black pieces.
initiallyFlipped - Whether the board should be flipped initially.
userPlayer - The Player for whom the user plays. It's only meaningful if this Game is of type MY_GAME and is a played game, this parameter should be null for all other cases.

Game

public Game(int gameType,
            Position initialPosition,
            int pliesSinceStart,
            java.lang.String whiteName,
            java.lang.String blackName,
            int time,
            int inc,
            int whiteRating,
            int blackRating,
            java.lang.Object gameID,
            java.lang.String ratingCategoryString,
            boolean isRated,
            boolean isPlayed,
            java.lang.String whiteTitles,
            java.lang.String blackTitles,
            boolean initiallyFlipped,
            Player userPlayer)
Creates a new Game with the given game properties. This constructor differs from the other one in that it doesn't let you specify separate time and increment for white and black.

Parameters:
initialPosition - The initial position in the game.
pliesSinceStart - The amount of from the actual beginning of the game to the inital position.
whiteName - The name of the player with the white pieces.
blackName - The name of the player with the black pieces.
time - The initial amount of time on the players' clock, in milliseconds.
inc - The amount of time the players' clock is incremented by
whiteRating - The rating of the player with the white pieces, or -1 if no rating (guest for example).
blackRating - The rating of the player with the black pieces, or -1 if no rating (guest for example).
isRated - Is the game rated?
gameID - A string identifying the game.
ratingCategoryString - A string identifying the rating category of the game ("Blitz" for example)
gameType - The type of the game - possible values are MY_GAME, OBSERVED_GAME and ISOLATED_BOARD.
isPlayed - Is this a real game? false if an examined game.
whiteTitles - The titles of the player with the white pieces.
blackTitles - the titles of the player with the black pieces.
initiallyFlipped - Whether the board should be flipped initially.
userPlayer - The Player for whom the user plays. It's only meaningful if this Game is of type MY_GAME and is a played game, this parameter should be null for all other cases.
Method Detail

getGameType

public int getGameType()
Returns the type of the game, either MY_GAME, OBSERVED_GAME or ISOLATED_BOARD.

getPliesSinceStart

public int getPliesSinceStart()
Returns the amount of half-moves made from the beginning of the actual game to the initial position as specified by this Game object. This will always be 0 for games played by the user. Note that this property, along with initialPosition may be modified.

getInitialPosition

public Position getInitialPosition()
Returns a copy of the initial position in the game.

setInitialPosition

public void setInitialPosition(Position initialPosition,
                               int pliesSinceStart)
Sets the initial position of the game to the given position. Usually, Game objects are supposed to be immutable, this exception is necessary because some commands (like clearboard, loadgame) modify the initial position of the game for all practical purposes, and it's not feasible to recreate the game on each such command. Note however, that whoever is modifying this should also take care to notify all the clients of the change.

getVariant

public WildVariant getVariant()
Returns the WildVariant of this Game.

getWhiteName

public java.lang.String getWhiteName()
Returns the name of the player with the white pieces.

getBlackName

public java.lang.String getBlackName()
Returns the name of the player with the black pieces.

getWhiteTime

public int getWhiteTime()
Returns the initial time on the clock of the player with the white pieces, in milliseconds.

getWhiteInc

public int getWhiteInc()
Returns the number of milliseconds by which the clock of the white player is incremented each time he makes a move.

getBlackTime

public int getBlackTime()
Returns the initial time on the clock of the player with the black pieces, in milliseconds.

getBlackInc

public int getBlackInc()
Returns the number of milliseconds by which the clock of the black player is incremented each time he makes a move.

getWhiteRating

public int getWhiteRating()
Returns the rating of the player with the white pieces.

getBlackRating

public int getBlackRating()
Returns the rating of the player with the black pieces.

isRated

public boolean isRated()
Returns true if this game is rated, false otherwise.

getID

public java.lang.Object getID()
Returns an object identifying the game. This object, when converted to a String (via the toString() method) could be displayed to the user.

getRatingCategoryString

public java.lang.String getRatingCategoryString()
Returns a String identifying the rating category of the game - this should be displayed to the user.

isPlayed

public boolean isPlayed()
Returns true if this is a played game, false if examined.

getWhiteTitles

public java.lang.String getWhiteTitles()
Returns the titles of the player with the white pieces.

getBlackTitles

public java.lang.String getBlackTitles()
Returns the titles of the player with the black pieces.

isBoardInitiallyFlipped

public boolean isBoardInitiallyFlipped()
Returns true if the board should be initially flipped.

isTimeOdds

public boolean isTimeOdds()
Returns true if this is a time-odds game.

getUserPlayer

public Player getUserPlayer()
Returns the player for whom the user plays. This is only relevant if the game is of type MY_GAME and is a played game, in all other cases, this method returns null.

isUserAllowedToMovePieces

public boolean isUserAllowedToMovePieces(Player player)
Returns true if the user is allowed to move the pieces of the given Player. Here are the values returned by this method in different cases:
  • The type of this game is MY_GAME and it's a played game - returns true if the given player is the userPlayer, otherwise returns false.
  • The type of this game is MY_GAME and it's an examined game - returns true always.
  • The type of this game is OBSERVED_GAME - returns false.
  • The type of this game is ISOLATED_BOARD - returns false, although implementations may want to do whatever they want in this case (they can allow the user to move any pieces if they want).

getResult

public int getResult()
Returns the result of the game. Possible values are WHITE_WINS, BLACK_WINS, DRAW, UNKNOWN_RESULT and GAME_IN_PROGRESS.

setResult

public void setResult(int result)
Sets the result of the game to the specified value. Possible values are WHITE_WINS, BLACK_WINS, DRAW and UNKNOWN_RESULT. This method may only be called once per Game object (when the game ends), and the caller is responsible for notifying all interested parties that the game ended.

getTCString

public java.lang.String getTCString()
Returns a string representing the time control of the game.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a textual representation of this Game.
